Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES ?; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE
Name: Isis breast-feeding Horus
Description: This small amulet in green faience represents Isis breast-feeding Horus. The goddess, who is seated on a throne, is wearing a Hathoric crown composed of a solar disk and a pair of horns. On the lateral sides of the throne and on the dress of the goddess we find the  ankh-sign, symbol of life. The front side of the throne is decorated by a sign of life and by a was-sceptre. The piece comes from the excavations of F. Griffith at Sanam in 1913-1914.
